channel.title: mint - companies
channel.description: Get the latest news and analysis on business, finance, politics from mint, the website of the Mint newspaper, one of India's leading business and financial dailies

item.title: Lodha's maiden Bengaluru project runs into legal hurdle
item.description: Residents of existing towers on the land Lodha acquired have accused the developer of changing the plan without their consent. RERA has asked the company to seek approval from two-thirds of the residents.

item.title: Nvidia invests $2 billion in CoreWeave, expands data centre partnership
item.description: Alongside the investment, Nvidia and CoreWeave have expanded their strategic partnership, aimed at accelerating CoreWeave’s data centre build-out to meet surging demand for AI-focused computing capacity.

item.title: Waaree Technologies to acquire majority stake in transmission tower firm for ₹1,225 crore
item.description: Waaree Renewable Technologies is acquiring a 55% stake in Associated Power Structures for ₹1,225 crore to enter the power transmission and substation EPC market.

item.title: Tariff wall: Indian internet gear, cable makers risk missing out on US data centre boom
item.description: American companies awarding orders worth billions of dollars to build infrastructure for AI companies. But US tarrifs have either squeezed margins or disrupted exports for Indian cable and equipment makers. &nbsp;

item.title: Why Amazon wants its sellers to create their own websites for free
item.description: Amazon is pushing SmartBiz, a free tool for Indian sellers to build websites. While this risks losing marketplace commissions and ad revenue, it secures Amazon’s role as the logistics and payment provider for the growing D2C sector.

item.title: Boeing expects more Dreamliner orders from India amid tariff concerns
item.description: Boeing anticipates an increase in Dreamliner orders in India, aiming to boost the aerospace sector. Despite challenges like tariffs and the AI171 crash investigation, the company is confident in overcoming hurdles and believes the demand for B787s will continue to grow.

item.title: Meta, Google, Y Combinator leaders call out Trump administration over Alex Pretti's death — ‘Only a matter of time’
item.description: Alex Pretti, a 37-year-old ICU nurse, was fatally shot Saturday by agents who were in the city as part of US President Donald Trump's crackdown on illegal immigration.

item.title: Republic Day 2026: Anand Mahindra, Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, Bill Gates, other business leaders extend wishes
item.description: Republic Day is celebrated across India on 26 January every year to commemorate the adoption of the Constitution. The day is marked by flag unfurling by the President and other dignitaries of states and UTs, along with parades and cultural programmes across the country.

item.title: Samsung Nears Nvidia’s Approval for Key HBM4 AI Memory Chips
item.description: Samsung Electronics Co. is getting close to securing certification from Nvidia Corp. for the latest version of its AI memory chip, called HBM4, making progress in narrowing the gap with rival SK Hynix Inc.

item.title: IRFC explores some Swiss franc swap to cut dollar risk
item.description: To address currency volatility, IRFC is considering converting part of its dollar loans into Swiss francs and diversifying its funding sources. With nearly $8 billion in overseas exposure, the company is also exploring refinancing metro rail projects, aiming to improve earnings.

item.title: Fidelity Fund Beating 96% of Peers Likes Japan’s AI-Linked Firms
item.description: Japanese shares’ ascent to record highs at the start of the year has reinforced a Fidelity International fund manager’s preference for smaller AI-related companies that still look affordable.

item.title: Indian IT’s mega deals spike on AI push, but there’s not much to celebrate yet
item.description: TCS, Cognizant and Infosys reported billion-dollar contracts but analysts say Fortune companies are reducing the number of IT vendors they work with to reduce their long-term software services costs.

item.title: Minnesota CEOs Seek De-Escalation After Border Police Shooting
item.description: More than 60 chief executive officers of Minnesota-based companies called for an immediate “de-escalation of tensions” between state, local and federal authorities as the state reels from another fatal shooting of an American by immigration agents.

item.title: Netflix vs Paramount: Here's what investors need to know about how the numbers stack up
item.description: Netflix vs Paramount: From savings to funding — Here's all investors and Warner Bros. shareholders need to know about how the bid numbers stack up against each other.&nbsp;

item.title: India’s private credit market is booming, says Moelis India CEO Manisha Girotra
item.description: Moelis India CEO Manisha Girotra outlined a 2026 outlook defined by the rapid expansion of private credit, the rise of dual-track exit strategies, and massive capital expenditure in AI-led infrastructure and healthcare.

item.title: ED chargesheets online gaming app WinZO, alleges players duped of ₹734 cr using bots
item.description: The Enforcement Directorate has charged WinZO and its promoters, alleging ₹734 crore losses due to manipulated algorithms. Details here.&nbsp;

item.title: Netflix CEO rejects Paramount's $108 billion offer for Warner Bros. amid Larry Ellison's backing — Here's why
item.description: Netflix CEO rejected Paramount's offer and said that without Larry Ellison's financial backing via independent financing, there is allegedly no chance that the company will be able to pull off its acquisition funding. Here's what you need to know.&nbsp;

item.title: JSW Steel sharpens expansion roadmap, eyes 56 mtpa capacity by FY31
item.description: The move comes as steel prices show early signs of stabilizing and the company steps up raw material sourcing.

item.title: JioStar moves Supreme Court against CCI probe over alleged abuse of dominance in Kerala TV market
item.description: JioStar has appealed a 3 December 2025 Kerala High Court order declining to stay the CCI probe and directing its completion within eight weeks. The Supreme Court will hear the matter on 27 January.

item.title: ACME Group plans $1.4 bn green methanol plant in Odisha, inks agreement
item.description: ACME Group has partnered with the Odisha government to invest $1.4 billion in a green methanol facility to meet the growing demand for sustainable maritime fuels.

item.title: Are your WhatsApp messages really private? Fresh lawsuit challenges Meta's privacy claims
item.description: Meta is being sued for allegedly misleading users about WhatsApp's encryption. An internation group of plaintiffs are arguing that the company can access private communications on its personal messaging platform.&nbsp;

item.title: This founder says 73 rejections did not discourage him, ‘want to get out of bed even without pay’
item.description: Fellow founder Jake Miller believes that despite the difficult start — he faced 73 rejections but was able to push through because he was working on his passion and not only for paycheques. Here's how…

item.title: Lawsuit Claims Meta Can See WhatsApp Chats in Breach of Privacy
item.description: An international group of plaintiffs sued Meta Platforms, Inc. alleging that the company has made false claims about the privacy and security of its WhatsApp chat service.

item.title: HHS Pauses, Then Restores, $5 Billion in State Health Grants
item.description: The US Department of Health and Human Services notified states on Saturday that it would pause public health grants worth about $5 billion, then hours later said it would lift the halt.

item.title: Infosys asks employees to share remote work electricity consumption data: Report
item.description: Infosys is collecting data on employees' household electricity consumption to mitigate its environmental impact through clean energy. The company encourages participation in a survey aimed at enhancing sustainability initiatives, while promoting energy conservation practices at home.

item.title: IndiGo relinquishes over 700 slots at domestic airports after 10% cut in winter flight program
item.description: The civil aviation ministry has invited other airlines to submit requests for operating domestic flights on these newly available slots

item.title: APSEZ to invest ₹30,000 crore for Vizhinjam Port development: Karan Adani
item.description: APSEZ will invest ₹30,000 cr in development of Vizhinjam sea port: Karan Adani.

item.title: Why Shark Tank judge Anupam Mittal thinks CEOs stepping down from their own startups is not a failure
item.description: Anupam Mittal backs CEOs and founders resigning from their own startups, emphasising that founders stepping aside for professional CEOs is beneficial for companies. Details here.

item.title: Higher cement sales help UltraTech beat earnings estimates
item.description: UltraTech Cement's consolidated net profit rises 27% year-on-year to ₹ ₹1,725.40 crore in the December quarter

item.title: Citigroup plans to lay off more employees in March — who will get impacted? Here's what report says
item.description: Citigroup plans new layoffs in March after cutting 1,000 jobs in January. The cuts, affecting mainly senior staff, are part of CEO Jane Fraser's cost-reduction strategy. Details here.

item.title: Chinese apps dominated Android and iOS downloads in US in 2025 — Here's how TikTok, CapCut, Temu, Shein fared
item.description: Des[ite pressure from the Donald Trump administration, Chinese apps continued to dominate download list in the United States last year. Here's how ByteDance's TikTok and CapCut, and fashion retailers Temu and Shein fared.

item.title: Not just Shanghai, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang likely to visit Beijing amid surprise customs block for H200 chip
item.description: Jensen Huang's annual Shanghai visit is likely to lead to a Beijing detour after Nvidia's H200 chips were met with a surprise customs block from Chinese authorities last week, as per a report. Here's what we know…

item.title: This investment bank chief's pay rose 21% to $47 million for 2025, beating JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon's salary hike
item.description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. CEO David Solomon saw his biggest pay hike yet, as the investment banker's compensation for 2025 jumped by 21% to $47 million, according to reports. Here's all we know…

item.title: US bribery case: Adani makes first legal submission, asks court to defer ruling
item.description: Gautam Adani and his nephew Sagar Adani have requested the US court to defer its ruling on the 21 January SEC motion, as their counsel and the US regulator were discussing a stipulation.

item.title: SEC agrees to dismiss case over crypto lending by Winklevoss' Gemini
item.description: In 2023, the SEC charged Genesis Global Capital and Gemini Trust Company with illegally selling securities to hundreds of thousands of investors through their crypto lending program.
